title: Riot Staff, your opinions?
body:
Just a silly question, but what do the Riot staff think about the whole running gag among players of instead calling it "Rito"?
Was curious if you all found it funny or stupid or whatnot.

replies.body:
I think watching the last 0:10 seconds of the URF preview video is the ONLY way to answer this question... 

http://youtu.be/misAyNLuoQg?t=3m12s

I hadn't ever seen that before, but that's hilarious! 
I wish I'd been here for Urf. I played around season 2 and then took a break and came back right after doombots ended.
what?! that has not been there. YOU DOCTORED THAT TAPE.
No, it's been there the ENTIRE time. I only found out because of comments.
A lot of us use the term now too. I know I do. Pretty much at this point it's become part of the community culture I think.
It definitely has! And it's cool to see that the staff are so close to the community that they pick these things up along the way. :D
When someone asks if I work at Riot, I usually reply with, "yeah, I work at Rito." I'm totally cool with it, personally. xD
I find that oddly hilarious and really cool that you guys are so chill about it. :)
I find it oddly hilarious that Rito is also the name of the main character of a Japanese manga series called To-Love Ru.
Honestly, it's not uncommon to see "RITO PLZ" on sticky notes around the office, affixed to mockups of art and features we want to make.

This is beautiful. 
I gotta look into working there someday. :0
